alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee; Ozaukee; Racine; Washington; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:54AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Ozaukee, Milwaukee, northeastern Racine, eastern Waukesha and southeastern Washington Counties through 715 AM CDT... At 654 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lannon to Muskego. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Milwaukee, Waukesha, West Allis, Wauwatosa, New Berlin, Brookfield, Greenfield, Menomonee Falls, Oak Creek, Muskego, Mequon, South Milwaukee, Cudahy, Whitefish Bay, Greendale, Pewaukee, Brown Deer, Sussex, St. Francis, and Hales Corners. This includes the following highways... Interstate 94 between mile markers 296 and 310. Interstate 43 between mile markers 52 and 61, and between mile markers 73 and 87. Interstate 41 between mile markers 40 and 54. Interstate 41/894 between mile markers 0 and 4. Interstate 41/43/894 between mile markers 5 and 9. Interstate 43/94 between mile markers 311 and 316. Interstate 41/94 between mile markers 317 and 327. Interstate 794 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
